## Preface

The following topics from @bird21 **Section M:** Statistics and probability are covered as part of the statistics component of ENGEN102.

- *Mean, median, mode and standard deviation* (pg. 743--750).
- *Probability* (pg. 751--763)
- *The Normal distribution* (pg. 771--779).
- *Sampling and estimation theories* (pg. 792--804).
- *Significance testing* (pg. 805--821).

::: {.callout-warning appearance="simple"}
This is not an exhaustive list of all topics covered in the statistics component of ENGEN102.
:::

## Answers to Relevant Practice from @bird21

The style of these brief solutions follows the same style as @bird21. That is, only the final answer is presented without full working using the methods taught in the statistics component of ENGEN102.

#### *Significance testing*

<ol>
  <li value="5"> (a\) *t*^\*^~[0.05]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 49) = -\{*t*^\*^~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 49)\} = -1.68, *t*~0~ = -2.04  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 75 hours, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* < 75 hours, at the 5% significance level  
  (b\) *t*^\*^~[0.01]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 49) = -\{*t*^\*^~[0.99]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 49)\} = -2.40, *t*~0~ = -2.04  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 75 hours, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* < 75 hours, at the 1% significance level
  <li> (a\) *t*^\*^~[0.9]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 1.48, *t*~0~ = 1.45  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 18 grams of carbon, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* &ne; 18 grams of carbon, at the 20% significance level  
  (b\) *t*^\*^~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 2.02, *t*~0~ = 1.45  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 18 grams of carbon, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* &ne; 18 grams of carbon, at the 10% significance level
  <li value="8"> (a\) *t*^\*^~[0.975]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 39) = 2.02, *t*~0~ = -2.49  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ = 0 ohms, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ &ne; 0 ohms, at the 5% significance level  
  (b\) *t*^\*^~[0.995]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 39) = 2.71, *t*~0~ = -2.49  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ = 0 ohms, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ &ne; 0 ohms, at the 1% significance level
  <li> *t*^\*^~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 2.02, *t*~0~ = 1.05  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~A~ &minus; *&mu;*~B~ = 0 seconds, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~A~ &minus; *&mu;*~B~ &ne; 0 seconds, at the 10% significance level
  <li> Assume *&alpha;* = 0.05  
  *t*^\*^~[0.975]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 2.57, *t*~0~ = -0.67  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~Analyst~ &minus; *&mu;*~Trainee~ = 0 grams, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~Analyst~ &minus; *&mu;*~Trainee~ &ne; 0 grams, at the 5% significance level
</ol>

#### Practice Exercise 311

<ol>
  <li value="2"> *t*^\*^~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 8) = 1.86, *t*~0~ = 2  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 80%, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 80%, at the 5% significance level
  <li value="4"> *x&#772;* = 10.38 kN, *s* = 0.34 kN  
  *t*^\*^~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 19) = 1.73, *t*~0~ = 1.70  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 10.25 kN, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 10.25 kN, at the 5% significance level
  <li> (a\) *t*^\*^~[0.975]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 9) = 2.26, *t*~0~ = 3.16  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 0.5 cm, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* &ne; 0.5 cm, at the 5% significance level  
  (b\) *t*^\*^~[0.995]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 9) = 3.25, *t*~0~ = 3.16  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 0.5 cm, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* &ne; 0.5 cm, at the 1% significance level
  <li> (a\) *t*^\*^~[0.9]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 1.48, *t*~0~ = 3.38  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 8000 times, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 8000 times, at the 10% significance level. Therefore the manufacturer's claim can be supported  
  (b\) *t*^\*^~[0.98]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 2.76, *t*~0~ = 3.38  
  Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 8000 times, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 8000 times, at the 2% significance level. Therefore the manufacturer's claim can be supported
</ol>
